entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued October 12 at 4:10PM AKDT until October 13 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT THURSDAY FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Visibility reduced to 1/4 mile or less. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches. Northeast winds 35 to 50 mph gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 12 at 4:10PM AKDT until October 13 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT Thursday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along The Coast Today Through Friday... Elevated surf and erosion is possible along the coast from the Colville River to Kaktovik Thursday through Friday. Southwesterly winds to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph tonight will shift to the west on Thursday. As the wind shifts, this may cause waves to crash high up the beach.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 12 at 4:10AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Air Pollution Alert for Dust for Rapid City west of the gap in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM MDT this evening... The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the South Dakota Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources. * WHAT...Northwest winds increasing to 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph in the afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Rapid City

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 13 at 2:38AM CDT until October 13 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN TRINITY AND NORTH CENTRAL POLK COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 245 AM CDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Polk; Trinity

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued October 13 at 2:38AM CDT until October 13 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN TRINITY AND NORTH CENTRAL POLK COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 245 AM CDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Polk; Trinity

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 2:24AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Trinity and northeastern Polk Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 222 AM CDT, doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Apple Springs, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Polk; Trinity

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 2:08AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Angelina County through 300 AM CDT... At 207 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Apple Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Angelina

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued October 13 at 3:34AM EDT until October 13 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York and northern Vermont. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Lamoille; Orleans; Western Franklin

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 11 at 1:43PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: An Air Quality Alert has been expanded by the Washington Department of Ecology in Yakima to include the Methow Valley. This includes the cities of Mazama, Winthrop, Twisp, Carlton, Methow, and Pateros. An Air Quality Alert remains in effect for Chelan and Douglas counties. These alerts are in effect until further notice. Particulate matter (PM2.5) levels may vary from unhealthy to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chelan; Douglas; Okanogan
